website_summaries.verdict: Cookbook from a popular blog meant to provide plant-based eaters with simple options for busy weekdays.
pros: Many of the 101 recipes are gluten-free
A beginner-friendly cookbook that's easy to use
Dishes are simple but taste gourmet
Recipes don’t take long to prep and cook
cons: Baking section is the book’s weakness according to some reviewers

customer_reviews.title: Delicious!
customer_reviews.text: I got this book because I had tried some of the recipes that Dana had posted online and I have never been disappointed in any of her recipes. They are easy enough to make, they use ingredients that are easy to find, and most important, they are delicious. My husband likes the recipes also, even though he is not a full time Vegetarian.
customer_reviews.author: Nature lover

customer_reviews.title: Bland, flavorless recipes
customer_reviews.text: I made a few things from this book after liking a couple of recipes on the blog and purchasing it. None of them turned out very well, always dull and bland. Vegan food can be so much more. There are plenty of vegan cookbooks you can look to instead... Thug Kitchen, Vegan Richa are a couple I can highly recommend. Don't waste your money or time on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Very Very Good
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this vegan cookbook. I think she uses it 5 out of 7 nights per week. I have only found two recipes to be unsatisfying. Everything else from this book has been absolutely wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: GregorioG

customer_reviews.title: Quite disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was so looking forward to get this book. I love Minimalist baker website. But this book is such a disappointment. The recipes on the website are so good and the recipes in the book are so boring. Literally maybe just a few I would try. Without any excitement though. Plus the photos are so colorless and sad. Hate to say this, but this is probably one of the worst cooking books I've seen. Returning back.
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana

customer_reviews.title: Great cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cookbook after making multiple recipes from the Minimalist Baker blog. The cookbook is excellent - the recipes are easy to follow and easy to make for those like myself who are not that skilled in the kitchen. My only complaint would be that a lot of the recipes call for replacement items (i.e. vegan butter for butter, vegan cream cheese for cream cheese, etc.) instead of finding plant based ingredients that aren't made to mimic animal derived items. For this reason, I only make these recipes sparingly. But I must say that almost everything I've made has been excellent, I will continue using it, and I'd definitely recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: S.R.K.

customer_reviews.title: Delicious!
customer_reviews.text: I love Minimalist Baker's blog and have been so happy with the recipes featured in the book! There are a variety of breakfast ideas, sides, lunch/dinner, desserts and beverages. There is definitely a theme to her meals which I would categorize as Thai, Indian or Middle Eastern types of foods. Many use the same ingredients and can be made in 30 mins or less. However, as most vegetarians/vegans know, you have to plan what meals you'll be making to make sure you have the ingredients in hand. Once you've got her basics you're set! I love the Vegan No Tuna Salad Sandwich and the Thai Baked Sweet Potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: kochano1

customer_reviews.title: Correct recipe index
customer_reviews.text: Love this cookbook. The pictures are great, the recipes I’ve tried so far have not disappointed. As I am transitioning to a more plant based diet, it is a treasure. The three star rating reflects the recipe index, the worst I’ve ever tried to negotiate. Instead of a simple alphabet system, the recipes are sorted by number of ingredients, amount of time involved, etc. Not a logical way most cooks look for recipes. As a result, I’m often looking on line for inspiration, not the book. If an addendum is ever published to redo the index, sign me up!
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cookbook, ordering a second copy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cook book the beginning of January and I ended up slitting up with my boyfriend. He asked me if he could keep the book as it would help him stay vegan and he is less experienced in cooking than I am. I ended up just having to get a new book because it is that awesome and I really wanted to try more. I must've made 5 recipes from the book during the short time that I had it. If you are unsure of becoming vegan, or eating your veggies, then you will be enthused with this book as it makes eating plant based easy, affordable, and delicious.
customer_reviews.author: Jos

customer_reviews.title: New vegan cookbook for Christmas
customer_reviews.text: Just received this as a Christmas present & there are a few recipes I am excited to make; butternut squash mac & cheese, new veggie burgers, beer cheddar soup & creamy broccoli cheddar soup, etc. On the con side the font listing the ingredients is miniscule for these middle aged eyes. Is it 1/4, 3/4? Difficult to make out. Also the prep time feels very understated as I read the ingredient list. Fingers crossed I find some fast new recipes for this busy person who still wants a home cooked meal!.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Recipes so good you can't tell it's vegan...
customer_reviews.text: I have been vegetarian since I was 10 years old, and now in my twenties have been trying to find some new recipes. I wasn't trying to go vegan but by using these plant based recipes which have been absolutely delicious each time, I haven't had any dairy or even bread for that matter for several weeks. Each recipe has healthy ingredients and most of my friends cannot even tell the recipes are vegan. Each meal is so flavorful and delicious, so I hope to see some more cookbooks from them in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Lauren Rau

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like this book.  But I didn't.
customer_reviews.text: The recipes were really too complicated to be minimalist. And they use too much oil. It ended up sitting unused on my cookbook bookshelf for over a year before I finally donated it.
customer_reviews.author: Biffermas

customer_reviews.title: Recipes that never fail
customer_reviews.text: Awesome cookbook for fail-proof and easy cooking. I have followed Minimalist Baker online for a couple years and the recipes NEVER fail, always yummy. That's a tough bill to fill, especially since cooking vegan and gluten-free has its hiccups. How wonderful to finally have a hard copy that I can flip through for inspiration in addition to her website/blog/emails. I believe that a good cookbook should have photos for each recipe given and this one does not disappoint. Enjoy this book in your cookbook collection. I certainly do. Another favorite: Vegan Richa's Everyday Kitchen. Awesome as well.
customer_reviews.author: sc uebelhor

customer_reviews.title: Full of go-to recipes to get tasty veggies in your diet
customer_reviews.text: I started using this cookbook at a time when I was learning about nutrition to help with some health issues, and it made both me and my partner feel like we weren't missing out on anything. My partner and I make the tabbouleh and the lasagna almost every week. Every once and a while for a treat, we'll make the spinach and artichoke dip or the chocolate chip cookies - both are so tasty and restaurant-quality. It's also really easy to substitute in some dairy, meat, or GF ingredients into these recipes as desired, and still get a super tasty product.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT ALREADY!!
customer_reviews.text: Best cookbook I have ever bought! I just went vegan and needed some direction when it came to making decent meals so I bought this cookbook and another (from a different cook). This one by far exceeded ALL expectations! The ingredients and meals are so easy! I was able to find all listed ingredients with relative ease in my small town and the recipes aren't complicated to actually make. Prep time was always under an hour and clean up was a breeze. If that wasn't great enough, she even included the nutritional information in the back!! OMG, THANK YOU! My non-vegan husband even enjoys the meals. I can't say enough about this cookbook!
customer_reviews.author: Steph M

customer_reviews.title: A well-used favorite
customer_reviews.text: Hands down, this is among my very favorite vegan cookbooks in my vast collection. Angela Lidden's first book, released in 2014 is another that captures a similar vibe. Dana's recipes aim for simplicity and familiarity yet also manage to feel fresh and unique. I pesonally tend to crave grounding, comfort food and big flavor in my meals and every recipe I've tried from this cookbook achieves that in spades. Dana's blog has become daily reading for me as well as she never fails to inspire with her steady stream of gorgeously photographed creations.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, but...
customer_reviews.text: I would've given the book 5 stars, but I was disappointed that so many recipes include oil in the ingredients. One of the many joys of the whole food, plant-based lifestyle is learning the science behind what we eat. Thanks to luminaries such as Dr. T. Colin Campbell and Dr. Caldwell Esselstyn we know that added oils in foods are very damaging to our arteries and contribute to serious chronic disease. I have learned that cooking without oil is easy and tasty, and since there is no such thing as a "heart healthy" oil, I will simply omit the oil from these recipes. The book itself is beautifully put together and I look forward to using it often, hopefully.
customer_reviews.author: Texan2011

customer_reviews.title: A vegan gluten free cookbook worth buying
customer_reviews.text: I found this cookbook at the library and liked the recipes so much that I decided to buy my own copy. The recipes are all vegan and mostly gluten free. I sometimes adjust the recipes to reduce the sugar and I never add salt, but these are still delicious. I do find many of the recipes take longer to prepare than they say. For me, this is a weekend cookbook rather than a work night one. But still one I'm happy to own. I especially like the recipe for the vegan tuna.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Delicious
customer_reviews.text: Amazing some photos from the cookbook attached. For the quiche I added some home made vegan “cheddar,” to give the quiche an extra cheddarry-egg look that we all know before we went vegan. Sometimes I don’t care about replicating the taste but I do remember the colors. Also, this is tastier than the animal ingredients anyways. Cheers! A quiche that will truly please your meat eating friends.
customer_reviews.author: JaGirl

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: After being vegetarian for a couple years, Dana was the one that convinced me I could rip the bandaid and cut out all animal products. I love this book. Her writing is like having a friend sitting next to you and talking you through it. No crazy ingredients. Just solid plant based food. We love the 20 Minute Vegan Queso, Creamy Tomato and Herb Bisque, Coconut Red Curry Vegetable Soup, White Bean Posole, Chickpea Fesenjan, and Chickpea Noodle Soup. The ice cream recipes are so amazing and her Vanilla Cupcakes are perfection.
customer_reviews.author: hbh

customer_reviews.title: Quality recipes for everyday living
customer_reviews.text: Amazing book, quality pictures & recipes, I will use this all the time. The recipes are all 10 ingredients or less, and they're ingredients that you probably already have in your house or are easy to find in your local grocery store. Great for the working person who doesn't have time to be fancy but still wants to eat yummy, healthy food!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Poorly written
customer_reviews.text: I do love the content, however, you guys need to look at a Betty Crocker cook book. You cannot say, make to taste, you must be definite. If you want it more tasty, add more? Also, the font on the measurements is so faint how can anyone see it? The table of contents is really confusing too. I have enjoyed it, however, in hard copy, it needs loads of improvements. Grateful. Many thanks.
customer_reviews.author: John Hudson

customer_reviews.title: I bought this book because I love the blog
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book because I love the blog, and it only seemed right to support the author's hard work. I love that the recipes are simple, don't use 15 million ingredients, don't use crazy obscure ingredients, and/or lots of processed junk. Most importantly, the food tastes delicious. The book is lovely, with many pictures, clear instructions, and useful information. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loving the simplicity
customer_reviews.text: The last thing I need when I'm tired and hungry is a complicated dish with lots of ingredients. Many recipes in this book are vegan adaptations to things I used to make, so they will be going into our regular rotation.
customer_reviews.author: Cindi Trunk

customer_reviews.title: Too basic
customer_reviews.text: Recipes beyond basic. Nothing exciting. Have seen the majority of the recipes included on Pinterest. Not worth $20.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: We LOVE this book
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this book. It arrived the day I got home from giving birth, and my husband cooked a handful of meals from it. Every single one was awesome. We love it so much I bought it for my mom, go help her go more plant-based!
customer_reviews.author: HDBSNE

customer_reviews.title: Easy to follow cookbook for the cooking challenged
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS COOKBOOK! Easy to follow and delicious. I’ve only made three recipes and one I adapted because I’m not a hollandaise sauce person in general and replaced with a MB hummus & lemon dressing. Still sooo good! Love the easy instructions and pantry page in the back to know what to keep stocked to make a variety of dishes. I’m not a big cooking fan but can’t live off seamless forever so the ten ingredients or less is my go to and there are so many to choose from! Look forward to many more plant based meals from this book.
customer_reviews.author: Noel Laws

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!  💟😍😊
customer_reviews.text: Those speaking food pictures on minimalist baker food blog always used to fill me up with all the energy and motivation to read, make and eat more. I couldnt resist myself when I saw the pre-book ordering... waiting everyday for the amazing piece to come and when it did it filled me with all the joy. what a beauty the book is! really... I have to explore more and more of it. Just loved it! 😘😘
customer_reviews.author: ankita

customer_reviews.title: I love this book.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried quite a few recipes from this book and her website. My husband and I love them all. He doesn’t even notice that they are vegetarian. They all have such good flavour. I even got my coworker to pick it up and encouraged a friend after bringing a meal to her house. Lots of Mexican and Thai recipes as well as American food.
customer_reviews.author: Marina🌿

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Photos and Delicious Food
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough great things about this cookbook. I waited months and months for this cookbook on preorder and I was so excited when it finally arrived that immediately I began cooking and even upgraded my blender within the week. Every recipe is delicious, filling and gets rave reviews from my "meat and potatoes" husband. I would not recommend the kindle version as this is not only a kitchen staple but the pictures are something to drool over on a rainy afternoon to inspire a superb and colorful dinner (and dessert if it's really gray outside).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love minimalist baker!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using minimalist baker's blog for a long time and just love her recipes! She was part of the reason I was able to go vegan. I bought these cookbooks to give to my dad and father-in-law since they both are trying to do more plant-based cooking. Great gift! Very nice hardcover cookbook!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Paulding

customer_reviews.title: If you like cooking, and enjoy vegan food
customer_reviews.text: I found the Minimalist Baker online and have been using her recipes everyday! If you like cooking, and enjoy vegan food, this cookbook is for you. Some of my favorite recipes include the black bean green chili taquitos and the sweet potato sage ravioli. If you're not sure you want to commit to buying the book, check out her blog because it's filled with deliciousness waiting to be made by you.
customer_reviews.author: hayley

customer_reviews.title: Really Good Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I really love this book. Everything I have made out of it has been very very good. It easy to use, and pretty friendly to people who like to cook, but are not exactly pros. I really think anyone wanting to include more plant-based meals would benefit from this book. There are several recipes in here that are literally my vegan staples now, my "go-to's" - which have helped me transition to a vegan so much!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Easy and healthy.
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge fan of the Minimalist Baker blog and Instagram so I was super excited when this book was announced. I've had great success with the recipes I have tried so far. Highly recommend. The recipes come together easily and without much trouble. My omnivore family approves too. Favorite so far are the breakfast burritos, the harissa romesco angel hair pasta, and the no tuna chickpea salad sandwich. I haven't had a single failure and I've made around a dozen recipes so far.
customer_reviews.author: Emh91

customer_reviews.title: Something Seems to be Missing.
customer_reviews.text: There is really only one recipe I like from this book and even then, I have to make my own tweaks to it - Thai sweet potatoes with chickpeas. Everything else has been quite disappointing. There are far too many good vegan/vegetarian recipes elsewhere to waste your time here.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ingredience are easy to find
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this book to see if basic ingredience would be enough for full favouring of meals. This book is awesome, easy to reproduce their recipes. Love that there are not a lot of ingredience to work with. the meals are fresh and full of flavour.
customer_reviews.author: jean lynner

customer_reviews.title: Great book - delicious, easy and healthy recipes
customer_reviews.text: This book has already become a staple in my kitchen, I love it! I usually flip through it before doing my grocery shopping to get inspired for what I would like to cook that week. With the variety of recipes in the book, it's easy to find something you know you like or on the days you are feeling creative there are ideas for trying something new (i.e. coconut sugar caramel sauce = yum!). My personal favorites so far include the smashed black bean taquitos and the enchiladas, both are delicious and not too difficult or time consuming to put together after a long day of work. I definitely recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: B. Curdt

customer_reviews.title: This was a gift .......and she loved it !!!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't try any recipes......I'm a retired cook (only cooked at home for my family) and my husband does it all now! The illustrations are excellent and there are lots of surprises and what looks like really good recipes in there. My daughter in law recommended this to me - she really loves it !
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: What a great book. I can't stop reading the recipes and looking at all the pictures. If you a vegan, you'll already have all the ingredients used in any of the recipes, if you are not, everything is easy to get. I'm not gluten free but almost all recipes come with gluten free options or are gluten free. I usually use most of my cookbooks for inspiration only and change the recipes but I can't wait to make lots of the meals from this book.
customer_reviews.author: Astrid

customer_reviews.title: Buy this cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: I ususally do not buy cookbooks, but I love Dana's blog so much that it was just a no-brainer. This cookbook is absolutely wonderful! The recipes are true to Minimalist Baker form, as is the photography. So far I've made the cobb salad, quiche, thai burgers, pizza burgers, cocoa burgers and the nachos. They've all turned out great - especially the quiche and the nachos. Buy this cookbook! It will be your go to during the week for easy, healthy, delicious recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this cookbook so
customer_reviews.text: I love this cookbook so, so much. I cook every single day, and about 45% of my recipes come from this book, and another 45% come from Love Real Food. The other 10% come from blogs and other veg cookbooks. I haven't made many of the baked goods featured in the cookbook, mainly because we're watching our macros. But the savory stuff... my goodness!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, easy vegan cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: I loved following this blog so I was very excited to find that they have a cookbook. The book itself is beautiful and well written, and I love the tasty recipes inside! Can’t wait to work my way through the whole thing. Definitely makes being vegan and GF enjoyable:)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful book, amazing vegan food
customer_reviews.text: Everything I have made from Dana's website has been wonderful, so I wanted to support her by buying her book. It does not disappoint! I have been eating primarily plant based for about a year and Dana's recipes have made the transition a pleasure. She is alspo a food photographer so everything is pictured and each page is gorgeous.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Crowe

customer_reviews.title: to my son's favorite pumpkin chocolate chip oat bread
customer_reviews.text: I have made 16 recipes since I purchased this book & every single thing I have made has come out amazingly delicious! From the weeknight burrito bowls, to my son's favorite pumpkin chocolate chip oat bread, to the chocolate shake to my fave adult beverage -the sangria. Each recipe is wonderful. I highly recommend this for anyone wanting easy,small recipes that make a big impact on your meals!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Whitehead

customer_reviews.title: I think I've only found one recipe that I haven't exactly loved but it took me a while to unearth it
customer_reviews.text: Being a vegan with a very non-vegan (more foodie) palate, it can be hard to find dishes that are highly satisfying. Coming across Dana's minimalistbaker.com website was a gift from the heavens. I think I've only found one recipe that I haven't exactly loved but it took me a while to unearth it ;) This cookbook arriving made me do a happy dance and it might have been a happier moment than Christmas morning. Love the book, love Dana's recipes. Winner!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Rebar

customer_reviews.title: Recipes appealing, size and faintness of the print not so.
customer_reviews.text: Just received this cookbook and would love to keep it and try the interesting recipes, but disappointed by the small, light print so I'll be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners and more advanced cooks alike!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book. As many others, I've been following minimalist baker's blog for quite some time and love her recipes. This is a good collection of inventive recipes. This cookbook is great for beginners to follow along step by step, but also inventive enough to be really good inspiration for more advanced cooks trying to spice things up a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra W.

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS A KEEPER!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this book and I knew that I would. I'm so happy that they've finally come out with it. But, I have to say, there is just one small detail that I wish was different. When you look at the ingredients, like 1/2 cup, or 1/4 tsp. etc, the fraction part of the ingredient list is very small, like tiny. It would have been so much more helpful if the print was just a bit larger. I'm sure this is just me, which is why it is still rated 5 stars, deservedly. Still I cannot wait to try so many of them out.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I usually dont love cookbooks but I have already tried 4 recipes and loved them all!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: LOVE This Book!
customer_reviews.text: I am SO happy about this purchase!!! I've made 7 recipes in the last couple of weeks and every single one was fantastic! The meat-eater in the house ate and enjoyed every dish as well. It may take some investment for some of the less common ingredients but it has been worth every cent. Quick, easy delicious recipes--This book is exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: Alarie Fam

customer_reviews.title: BEST Cookbook for a healthy family
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this cookbook. Every single recipe is easy to make and absolutely delicious. The ingredients are healthy and my kids love every recipe in this book. This cookbook is our favorite family cookbook, and I HIGHLY recommend it. I hope that Dana continues to write more cookbooks in the future. Thank you for this wonderful book!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My most used cookbook
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic cookbook for vegans and those who are gluten free (or both). Easy to understand. Tasty. Every recipe I've made so far is a winner. This is my most used cookbook. I hope she writes another cookbook soon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite cookbooks!
customer_reviews.text: What a great cook book! I have already added several to our regular menu. Well written, delicious, healthy, lots of gluten free options! I am very happy with this purchase and highly recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: A family favorite
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful pictures and delicious recipes. I ordered a second copy a few months after the first just to have a spare. This book taught me to really cook vegan food, rather than simply omitting meat, eggs, and dairy. These recipes have a richness and flavor depth that had been lacking to the meals I used to prepare. My non-vegan son likes all the recipes we have tried. And my vegan daughter tells me to stop buying cookbooks. She says, "Just make anything from the Minimalist Baker, and I'll like it."
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: A must for any kitchen
customer_reviews.text: A perfect cookbook for anyone, especially if you don't have the luxury of time or money to spend on creating fancy dishes. The food here is creative, nutritious, delicious and presents well but is easy to prepare from mostly basic staples. Suitable for any skill level.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Beach

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, tasty recipes
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, tasty recipes! Good variety and pictures and information on each recipe. The only area in need of improvement is that amount of time it takes to make a recipe in comparison to the time stated in the book. In our experience, it takes longer than what is said to make everything. Overall great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love this amazing cookbook!!
customer_reviews.text: OMG this cookbook is amazing!! Sun-dried tomato Hummus, creamy tomato bisque, to die for lemon cheesecake with strawberry sauce, chickpea fesenjun just a few tried and true amazing, mouth watering delights from this amazing healthy, plant based cookbook!!
customer_reviews.author: Leah Saks

customer_reviews.title: STUNNING LAYOUT
customer_reviews.text: I eat with my eyes, so this book is so perfect for me. Most of the recipes have a beautiful, professionally taken picture associated with them and it really helps me figure out what I'm going to want to eat. There are nutritional facts for the recipes also (estimates of course) which is an amazing extra effort that Dana put into the book to make it doubly awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Rower

customer_reviews.title: Soooo good
customer_reviews.text: We bought this book and it sat on the shelf for quite a while before we made anything from it. After making the first dish (chickpea fesenjan) we returned to make many more, and have NEVER been disappointed. Highly recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Pammo

customer_reviews.title: A favorite
customer_reviews.text: I've followed the author on Instagram for several years, and thought it was time to buy her book. I love it! Beautiful photos, and pleasing to read.
customer_reviews.author: Kierna K

customer_reviews.title: Vegan food at its yummiest
customer_reviews.text: I've had this cookbook for a couple of months now. I make a biweekly menu. I've used around 20 recipes from this cookbook and have yet to make something that my family or I haven't liked. On a few occasions, I've altered the seasonings just a bit because we enjoy heartier flavors than most. But overall, this is one of my top 5 all time favorite cookbooks. The creativity is there. The flavor is there. The nutrition is there. An amazing book, for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: I love Minimalist Baker
customer_reviews.text: I love Minimalist Baker; they always have great recipes, better than most vegan websites and cookbooks I've tried. I also highly recommend their book "31 Meals," it's even better than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Dalfonso

customer_reviews.title: Most are very easy, well
customer_reviews.text: Just get this book. Most are very easy, well, actually ALL are easy recipes to make (so far). A few are more time consuming but totally worth the time and effort. This is one of my faves. I'm an Isa fan, and this is right up there, too. Really good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Boot girl

customer_reviews.title: Delicious gluten free vegan options!
customer_reviews.text: Another great book that I'm getting some wonderful gluten free vegan recipes from! The BBQ sauce recipe alone is worth the book. But I've found many simple gems in here.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer R

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Just like the website. I go back and forth between a regular diet, plant based diet and being vegan. I’m ready to jump all the way into plant based eating for a healthier life. The only downside is I have to get used to coconut as an ingredient. I hate coconut.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Best vegan cookbook I've come across!
customer_reviews.text: I've lost count of the number of recipes I've made from this cookbook. Haven't hit a bad one yet! So many of these have become my go-to meal prep dinners. No crazy/weird ingredients or recipes that take forever to cook. Highly recommend to vegans and non-vegans alike.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Suri

customer_reviews.title: This book did not disappoint! Delicious!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a huge fan of her blog and this cookbook did not disappoint. The recipes work and are delicious too. I turn to it again and again. Most of them are simple and use more normal ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: C. Frund

customer_reviews.title: Everyday Cooking indeed!
customer_reviews.text: Dana Shultz and her husband are just killing it! We have been cooking their recipes since early in their blogging and they just don't miss. The ideas they have, the amount of cooking time, the flavors - are everything we're looking for. We also recommended her recipes frequently and always get such great feedback. We all like to cook, and we cook a lot of other author's recipes, but theirs are so yummy. Great book.
customer_reviews.author: T. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Worth all your sheckles...
customer_reviews.text: Really amazing recipes! I've never heard of Minimalist Baker before - though I now know she has a beautiful food blog! I only came across this cookbook in related items I might like on amazon, and boy, I am glad I decided to buy it, because it is wonderful! I will highly recommend this cookbook to my friends and cannot wait to make every recipe in here for my family!
customer_reviews.author: Prescott Jones

customer_reviews.title: Simple, tasty recipes with great pictures
customer_reviews.text: One of my all time favorite plant based cookbooks. Recipes are simple meals that pack a lot of flavor. You won’t find weird, hard to find ingredients in these recipes like Iv seen in other plant based cook books-(arrow root powder, etc). Besides the nutritional yeast that you’ll need to get at Whole Foods, everything else is chain grocery store friendly .
customer_reviews.author: Nicemannersbabe

customer_reviews.title: Love This Book!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several recipes in here and have been really pleased with everything. I find the ingredients easy to find, the instructions clear and accurate and the results are tasty! I like that most of the recipes are takes on familiar crowd pleasers so I feel comfortable making them for non- plant based eaters in my life.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: 10 STARS
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE the Minimalist Baker! Her recipes are ALWAYS fantastic!!! I am a whole-food vegan and turn to her first when searching for a recipe. I was very excited to see she had a cookbook available on Amazon...I LOVE Prime :) Her recipes are easy to follow and always taste great!
customer_reviews.author: Tim C.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Recipes for a Picky Eater
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough great things about this cookbook. Just like their website, the recipes are all very easy to follow, use minimal ingredients, have great pictures, and everything we have made so far tastes amazing! My husband and I switched to a plant-based diet about 5 months ago and so far this cookbook and their website have been the best resources we have found. I am a very picky eater and I love these recipes!
customer_reviews.author: VegMama16

customer_reviews.title: Realistic and great tasting
customer_reviews.text: Realistic real life foods. Taste great all levels of cooking experience. Really likes the variety of recipes and snack options. I use this cook book regularly
customer_reviews.author: S. Collins

customer_reviews.title: If you are a Vegan you Need to Buy This Book.
customer_reviews.text: Dana is one my favorite vegan recipe guru's, even before her book came out I had bookmarked her site and she is my go to person anytime I need a recipe. If you are a vegan, and love great food you NEED this book. And yeah we can get tons of free recipes off the web but why not support a small business in the USA living the dream and loving what she does.
customer_reviews.author: Shanon S.

customer_reviews.title: I am so glad I got this book
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I got this book. I follow her on Instagram and love the recipes. I cooked the muffins the second day I had the book and they were a Vegan healthy option that were well received by non vegans!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Weisheit

customer_reviews.title: Don't Eat Vegan Without It
customer_reviews.text: Fan of the website? You're bound to be a fan of the book. Kindle version is very reasonably priced and I'm happy to throw a little financial support Dana Schultz's way, since she's responsible for so much happy eating around our place.
customer_reviews.author: ConradColeridge

customer_reviews.title: I love this book
customer_reviews.text: I love this book. I'm not a vegan, so sometimes I'll mess with the recipes a bit, but often I find them awesome as is! If you aren't vegan, but like to try new things, I'd definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great vegan recipes
customer_reviews.text: This has become our go-to cookbook! Great vegan recipes. We make the chickpea stuffed sweet potatoes and several kinds of veggie burgers regularly. A must have for vegetarians.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Buy this book for the best wheat-free vegan chocolate chip cookies you've ever had!
customer_reviews.text: Really wonderful recipes, easy to follow. Lots of wheat-free options also. The chocolate chip cookies were the best ever! Worth the whole book just for the dessert recipes.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal Jennilee

customer_reviews.title: Don't Let "Baker" Throw You Off...
customer_reviews.text: Great selection of vegan and gluten free recipes of all kinds! I haven't made anything from this book or her blog that I didn't like. Highly recommend even for those just looking for ways to cut back on meat and dairy consumption. All dishes are appealing, fairly easy to make, and provide great tasting & healthy alternatives for many traditional favorites! Love this book!!!
customer_reviews.author: C. Elam

customer_reviews.title: Gluten-Free and Vegetarian
customer_reviews.text: I hate cooking but I love this cookbook. Recipes are easy to follow and most ingredients are pantry/grocery staples. I began following first on Instagram and found I was making a lot of the recipes. I was thrilled to have a hard cover cookbook that can sit on my counter while I cook. I am against electronics on the counter near water/liquids, plus my hands are always wet.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Roberts

customer_reviews.title: I've loved every recipe I've made so far in this book
customer_reviews.text: I've loved every recipe I've made so far in this book! They're easy to follow, healthy and absolutely delicious. I have many (many many!) vegan cookbooks and this is on the top of my pile right now. When I first got it, I started marking pages for recipes I want to try until I realized I was tagging most of the pages. I plan to make my way through this entire book!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best beginner vegan cook book.
customer_reviews.text: My wife has many vegan cook books, and this is the one she recommends for people just beginning to enter the realm of vegan cooking. Would certainly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Healthy easy recipes
customer_reviews.text: Found the recipes on the author's website but glad I found the cook book. Healthy and easy to make recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn Avendano-Loza

customer_reviews.title: Easy vegan/plant based recipes, packed with flavor!
customer_reviews.text: Was not disappointed. I’ve only had this for a couple weeks and used it heavily! Very yummy recipes. I love minimalist baker!
customer_reviews.author: Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, easy to follow recipes
customer_reviews.text: This book is wonderful!!! I have made several recipes and they were all delicious. Easy to follow with ingredients that are easy to find without needing to go to special stores!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: A great addition to any vegan cookbook collection
customer_reviews.text: This book has soooo many recipes I want to try, I am really happy I bought if. Some great photos, and wonderful, flavorful recipes. It will most likely become one if my go to vegan cookbook from now on. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie P

customer_reviews.title: Great for any vegan foodies in your
customer_reviews.text: Full of several delicious recipes. Bought this for my wife for Christmas and she loves it. We have used several recipes from it. Great for any vegan foodies in your family
customer_reviews.author: Joshua R.

customer_reviews.title: This book has convinced me to stay with a vegan eating plan
customer_reviews.text: I am brand new to the vegan lifestyle and feared that I couldn't stick to it. What a blessing to discover this book! The recipes are so easy to make and so delicious. Thanks to Dana Shultz I now have no reason to go back to my old ways of eating. I am now a devoted fan.
customer_reviews.author: Nanette Gerdts

customer_reviews.title: Buy this cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite vegan author! All her recipes that I’ve made have been a success! Some of the most easy and delicious recipes I’ve ever had! Makes eating vegan fun :)
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Pretty tasty
customer_reviews.text: Recipes are pretty tasty... I wish the word font on the recipes would have been maybe smaller to be more concise and have a recipe per page, but each recipe I have tried has been pretty simple and tasty.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: vegan goodness
customer_reviews.text: amazing cookbook! vegan heaven in recipe form. minimalist baking is my go to blog and now the cookbook is here! the photography is incredible and makes you want to cook every single thing the day you get the book. mouthwatering! i have made a few things and all have been flavorful and on point. thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn

customer_reviews.title: Great book and easy recipes!
customer_reviews.text: I love this book! It really only has few ingredients in each recipe and i've made 4 recipes so far and they taste so good. I wanted to be meat free for a while and this book has made it real easy.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: I don't like spending more than $15 on cookbooks
customer_reviews.text: I have tried so many recipes on the blog and figured I should purchase the cookbook. Normally, I don't like spending more than $15 on cookbooks, so it took me a while to make the jump, but I am SO glad I did. I made some already and all are as good as I expected, if not better. My week is going to be full of these recipes. The best thing about it is a small grocery bill--a lot of these utilize staple goods that I already have at home! I can't suggest this cookbook enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Several favorites in this cookbook that we have on a weekly rotation. Love the simplicity of the recipes as well. Good variety of protein sources without overuse of tofu or Soy products.
customer_reviews.author: Paleomomma32

customer_reviews.title: One of my absolute favorite cookbooks! The recipes are simple
customer_reviews.text: One of my absolute favorite cookbooks! The recipes are simple, with not too many ingredients, and are absolutely delicious. Several recipes from this book have become staples for me, and I look forward to trying more of them!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: I am so happy that Dana created this cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy that Dana created this cookbook. The recipes are easy and simple to follow with simple ingredients that are not too hard to find. The tomato basil soup with filled with favor, I really enjoyed it and can't wait to see what lies ahead.
customer_reviews.author: Sleepinbeauty131

customer_reviews.title: Delicious Recipes
customer_reviews.text: Our family has loved every recipe I have prepared from this cookbook. My teenaged son is even enjoying eating plant-based foods now.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Awesome website & book
customer_reviews.text: I love this cookbook but I prefer the online content. Just bc I'm more tech than paper with recipes. Having said that, each recipe in this book is a 4-5 star recipe. Perfect for a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Johnson

customer_reviews.title: She was so excited as she had gotten recipes from their website before that she had loved. I looked through it and was very exci
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my daughter who has celiac disease and is trying to eat healthier. She was so excited as she had gotten recipes from their website before that she had loved. I looked through it and was very excited about many of the recipes. I may have to get a copy for myself as she took hers back to college with her.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher Mom

product_meta.title: Minimalist Baker's Everyday Cooking: 101 Entirely Plant-based, Mostly Gluten-Free, Easy and Delicious Recipes
